problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following situations would it be preferable to model using continuous variables instead of discrete variables? <<
[x] Production of nails in a plant [x] Production of ketchup in a Heinz factory [ ] Production of airplanes [ ] Production of a custom part in a job shop
[Explanation] If we measure nails by kilograms or ketchup by liters, a continuous model will predict behavior with practical accuracy, and it would probably be easier to work with than a discrete model. Such a model would not be useful to predict the behavior of an airplane factory or a job shop. [Explanation]
